Certainly, here are some movies and TV shows that have similar representations of queer love and relationships:

1. Pose - This TV show focuses on the queer and trans ballroom scene in New York City in the 1980s and 90s. It features a diverse cast of LGBTQ characters and explores themes of family, love, and identity.

2. Moonlight - This movie tells the coming-of-age story of a young black man named Chiron, who grapples with his identity and sexuality in a rough Miami neighborhood. It features a powerful portrayal of queer love and community.

3. Call Me By Your Name - This movie tells the story of the summer romance between a teenage boy named Elio and an older graduate student named Oliver. It explores themes of desire, power dynamics, and the struggles of coming out.

4. Schitt's Creek - This TV show follows the lives of the wealthy Rose family, who lose their fortune and are forced to move to a small town. The show features several queer characters and their relationships, which are portrayed in a positive and authentic way.

5. Sense8 - This TV show tells the story of eight strangers from around the world who suddenly become mentally and emotionally connected. It features a diverse cast with LGBTQ characters and storylines, highlighting the importance of family and community.

All of these movies and TV shows offer authentic and nuanced representations of queer love and relationships, much like the works of Alison Bechdel.
